intro: Britoa guazumifolia, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Britoa guazumifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
